Description: Plaster seal from a wine amphora stopper. Greek text surrounds central phallic(?) motif.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Naukratis, Probably from the Ptolemaic and Roman town area.
Curator's comments: Plaster seal top of wine amphora stopper type 1 (Thomas 2011). Impression of missing round cut sherd bung shows clear wheel mark impressions. This method of sealing wine amphorae was common in Egypt (its most likely origin) during the Early Imperial Roman period (Bailey 2007; Bos 2007; Bos & Helms 2000; Cashman et al. 1999; Cuvigny 1998 ; Denecker & Vandorpe; 2007; Dieleman 1998; Johnson 1979; Mayerson 2001; Moulder 2007; Nachtergael 2000; Smith 1883; Thomas 2011; Thomas & Tomber 2006; Vandorpe 2005).
